With school now underway, many working parents are facing the added stress of finding a safe place for their children during the day that can also support their remote learning. The good news is that there is ample licensed child care available across the state, and we are making it as easy as possible for families to find it. In partnership with Child Care Resources and Referral, the NC Department of Health and Human Services created a free hotline to connect families to licensed care for their school-age children. Families can call the hotline at 1-888-600-1685.

There are several things each year that signify the end of summer and the beginning of a new school year.

A favorite among BCPS staff, especially our directors and principals, and definitely our students and families is the annual Build A Backpack event at The Outreach Center, which is usually held the 3rd Saturday in August.

This event this year was one of many lost to COVID-19.

We did not get to see students’ smiling faces as they picked out their backpack, jumped in the bouncy house or gazed in awe at a firetruck.

But thanks to the Burke County United Way, The Outreach Center and a generous donation from Chartwells, 1,000 students were still able to receive free backpacks filled with much-needed school supplies.

At Monday's Board of Education meeting, Superintendent Dr. Larry Putnam recognized these agencies for their partnership, for their valuable work in our community and their support of Burke County Public Schools students.

The Outreach Center Burke County United Way Chartwells K12

NCSSM-Morganton
May 12 at 1:37 PM ·

Today’s stop on our stay-at-home tour of the NCSSM-Morganton campus is Goodwin Hall, a historic structure under renovation to feature our main welcome space (akin to Durham’s Bryan Lobby for all of our #NCSSMuni viewers out there!). Many of the existing spaces in this beautiful early-20th century building will remain with slight tweaks for increased accessibility – elevator access to all four floors, outdoor staircases, bull-pen style office bays, and even a small catering kitchen to maximize use of a penthouse conference room with incredible views. As you can see in this building and those that we’ll be touring in the days to come, designing spaces for connection, collaboration and community are at the heart of the NCSSM-Morganton campus plans.

If you’ve enjoyed this peek at our progress here in Morganton, be sure to stay tuned for our next stop on the tour, the site of our Academic Commons, and catch the full Road to Morganton behind the scenes peek in all its low-budget glory on May 18th!

post_text: NC Gov. Roy Cooper announced Friday afternoon that due to Covid-19 students and educators will not return to school buildings for the remainder of this school year. Remote learning continues in Burke County Public Schools with our third phase of supplemental learning materials being released next week. You may recall back in March, the Burke County Board of Education amended the 2019-2020 school calendar to move the spring break vacation days to the end of the school calendar year, making May 29 the final day of our student calendar. To students, please know that we miss you and hope you are staying safe and healthy. To our teachers and staff, we say thank you for your continued commitment to students and families. And to our high school seniors, please know that we are making plans to recognize you and your accomplishments in special ways and will release more information regarding graduations soon. Thank you for your patience and understanding during these fluid and unprecedented times.

post_text: We love these photos and stories from Ray Childers Elementary School kindergarten teacher Christal Williams. Her class is accustomed to teacher assistant Melanie Hendrix reading Junie B. Jones chapters to them after lunch. To stay in touch with her kinders while school is closed, Ms. Hendrix records herself reading and shares it on ClassDojo for her students to watch and listen. The other photo is Ms. Williams teaching a lesson from her living room. She has taped photos of her students' faces to toilet paper tubes and arranged them like they are sitting on a rug in her classroom. She too records her lessons on ClassDojo for students to watch and tries to use their names during the lessons. Just another example of how BCPS continues to Ignite Learning for a Brighter Future, even in the midst of a pandemic.

Want to volunteer for the Red Cross? Attend this virtual volunteer fair April 28.

365 days a year, the Red Cross team is working on keeping families in Burke County safe from home fires, storms, and other emergencies. They do this via preparedness education and direct first response to provide financial assistance to families in need.

Even in the COVID-19 environment, the Red Cross is still recruiting volunteers to learn how to do some of its core functions virtually and remotely. This, and delivering key parts of the Red Cross mission including running safe, lifesaving blood drives, and providing casework assistance to veterans.

Contact Adrian Mines, volunteer recruitment specialist, at adrian.mines@redcross.org.

Burke County Public Library
April 7 at 5:00 PM ·

Due to the governor's statewide stay at home order, all libraries are closed to the public. No book pick up is available.

What is available?
Book boxes/drops at all sites are open for you to return books, and no fines will accumulate for late books during our closure.

Wifi passwords have been removed, and you can connect to our wifi in all of our parking lots. Just remember to practice social distancing. Using our wifi indicates adherence to our acceptable use policy (http://bcpls.org/policies.php).

eBooks and Audiobooks from Overdrive & online resources through NC Live (including language learning programs, videos, auto repair guides, and more) are always available – visit http://bcpls.org/onlineresources.php for links and details.

We are available at the libraries for phone questions Mon-Fri from 8am to 5pm. Please call us with questions, or to renew or get a library card.

#BCPLS #LiveWellAtYourLibrary #LiveWellAtHome #FreeInternetAccess #NCLive #eBooks #OverDrive
